page.title: 05HOLIDAY CAMP (continued)
page.content: The string of holiday camps along the coast reflects the {history} of {holidays} over the last 50 years. Originally they were of easy access to working families from London. The railway ran special Saturday afternoon trains from Liverpool Street station which allowed Saturday morning workers to start their holiday straight after work. The trains called at all stations up the coast to North Norfolk. The changing fortunes of the Camps have been linked to changes in holidays and {travel}. Nowadays, most people arrive by coach or by car. Pontin's original idea was that a holiday should cost not more than one week's wages and prices per person are still in the same ratio.
